snippet: It’s too early to know whether the trend of slower growth will persist after the economy improves, but controlling spending will require reforms.
abstract: Editorial contends that it is too earlier to decide whether reduced growth in United States health care spending in 2010 is due to increased system efficiency or the economic recession; notes bigger changes are in store in 2014 when expanded Medicaid takes effect under health care reform law.
lead_paragraph: It’s too early to know whether the trend of slower growth will persist after the economy improves, but controlling spending will require reforms.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
